issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: ELB should create ASG per AZ

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: This issue has been validated/reproduced, but has not been prioritized yet.
status.name: Confirmed

fields.description:
The system was pretty much overloaded with many ELBs (100) each of which has multi AZ enabled. Suddenly ASGs for each ELB starts to terminate instances and re-launches. It takes several cycles of terminating/launching until system becomes stable.

{code}
[root@g-08-03 elb]# euscale-describe-scaling-activities euca-internal-elb-000451552736-mytest-elb-83006 --show-long
euscale-describe-scaling-activities: error (ValidationError): 'euca-internal-elb-000451552736-mytest-elb-83006' for parameter ActivityIds.member.1 is invalid
[root@g-08-03 elb]# euscale-describe-scaling-activities -g euca-internal-elb-000451552736-mytest-elb-83006 --show-long
ACTIVITY	267d5415-f61b-4c21-8dd8-6fe70ebbc5f3	2015-07-31T22:22:03.134Z	euca-internal-elb-000451552736-mytest-elb-83006	Successful		At 2015-07-31T22:21:58Z an instance was started in response to a difference between desired and actual capacity, increasing the capacity from 2 to 3.	100	Launching a new EC2 instance: i-91c2b66f		2015-07-31T22:21:58.296Z

fields.summary: Autoscaling groups for multi-az terminates/launches instances

comments.body: Has been seen multiple times. When this is reproduced again, engage appropriate devs.
[~sjones] For ELB, EUCA-11245 addresses the problem. Do you want to address the issue in ASG? If so you can take the ticket. Otherwise, I'll close this.
[~spark], I'll change the priority and move to the backlog for now.
[~sjones], do you think this is still an issue?

[~vasya], I would assume this is still an issue on zone failure. I think this issue occurs when there are many instances that need to be migrated to other zones and there are ec2 failures launching instances.
